actions.committee: Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation, S. Rept. 95-199.
Measure indefinitely postponed in Senate (Provisions inserted in H.R. 6010 as passed Senate).

official_title: A bill to amend section 406(a) of the Federal Aviation Act of 1958 (49 U.S.C. 1376) to provide explicit statutory authority for the payment of "flow-through" subsidy pursuant to an experimental program administered by the Civil Aeronautics Board during the period August 1, 1973 through July 31, 1975.

summary.text: Amends the Federal Aviation Act of 1958 to authorizes the Civil Aeronautics Board to make subsidy payments for airmail service performed by holders of certificates authorizing airmail transportation and to certain "air taxi operators" for airmail services performed between August 1, 1973, and July 31, 1975, where such payments have already been provided by Board order.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 406(a) of the Federal Aviation Act of 1958 (49 U.S.C. 1376) to provide explicit statutory authority for the payment of "flow-through" subsidy pursuant to an experimental program administered by the Civil Aeronautics Board during the period August 1, 1973 through July 31, 1975.
